conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and relative positions of objects and light source.
Light source positioned such that shadows A, B, C, and D are cast in front of objects.
Shadows are elongated towards the front, indicating light source is behind objects.
When light source moves to back left or right, it changes angle of light relative to objects.
Back left movement causes shadows to shift to the right.
Shadows will be cast more towards the right side of objects with back left movement.
Back right movement causes shadows to shift to the left.
Shadows will be cast more towards the left side of objects with back right movement.
As light source moves further away, shadows become longer.
Angle of light increases, causing shadows to stretch out more.
Shadow A moves right if light moves back left, left if light moves back right, becomes longer in both cases.
Shadow B moves right if light moves back left, left if light moves back right, becomes longer in both cases.
Shadow C moves right if light moves back left, left if light moves back right, becomes longer in both cases.
Shadow D moves right if light moves back left, left if light moves back right, becomes longer in both cases.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the right and become longer when light source moves to back left.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift to the left and become longer when light source moves to back right.
